message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public class JSONIteratorAuthor implements Iterator<Author> {
   private Iterator<Object> authors;

   public JSONIteratorAuthor(JSONArray jsonArray){
       this.authors = jsonArray.iterator();
   }

   @Override
   public boolean hasNext() {
       return this.authors.hasNext();
   }

   public Author next() {
       if(this.hasNext()){
           Author a = new Author(0, "", "");
           JSONObject authorNode = (JSONObject) authors.next();
           a.setFirstName((String) authorNode.get("first_name"));
           a.setLastName((String) authorNode.get("last_name"));
           return a;
       }
       else {
           return null;
       }
   }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the code provided, the authors variable is of type Iterator<JSONObject>. To iterate over a JSONArray, you need to change the type to Iterator<Object> and cast the elements to JSONObject inside the next() method. Additionally, the constructor should take a JSONArray as a parameter instead of a JSONObject.
